014package org.microbean.bean;
015
016import java.lang.constant.Constable;
017import java.lang.constant.ConstantDesc;
018import java.lang.constant.DynamicConstantDesc;
019import java.lang.constant.MethodHandleDesc;
020
021import java.util.ArrayList;
022import java.util.List;
023import java.util.Objects;
024import java.util.Optional;
025
026import java.util.function.Predicate;
027
028import javax.lang.model.element.Element;
029import javax.lang.model.element.ElementKind;
030import javax.lang.model.element.Parameterizable;
031import javax.lang.model.element.QualifiedNameable;
032import javax.lang.model.element.TypeElement;
033
034import javax.lang.model.type.ArrayType;
035import javax.lang.model.type.DeclaredType;
036import javax.lang.model.type.IntersectionType;
037import javax.lang.model.type.ReferenceType;
038import javax.lang.model.type.TypeKind;
039import javax.lang.model.type.TypeMirror;
040import javax.lang.model.type.TypeVariable;
041import javax.lang.model.type.WildcardType;
042
043import org.microbean.lang.Lang;
044import org.microbean.lang.TypeAndElementSource;
045
046import static java.lang.constant.ConstantDescs.BSM_INVOKE;
047
048import static org.microbean.bean.ConstantDescs.CD_Assignability;
049
050import static org.microbean.lang.ConstantDescs.CD_TypeAndElementSource;
051
052/**
053 * A class encapsulating CDI-compatible assignability ("matching") rules as applied to {@link TypeMirror}s.
054 *
055 * @author <a href="https://about.me/lairdnelson/" target="_top">Laird Nelson</a>
056 *
057 * @see #matches(TypeMirror, TypeMirror)
058 */
059// Applies CDI assignability semantics to types.
060public final class Assignability implements Constable {
061
062
063  /*
064   * Instance fields.
065   */
066
067
068  private final TypeAndElementSource tes;
069
070
071  /*
072   * Constructors.
073   */
074
075
076  /**
077   * Creates a new {@link Assignability}.
078   *
079   * @see #Assignability(TypeAndElementSource)
080   */
081  public Assignability() {
082    super();
083    this.tes = Lang.typeAndElementSource();
084  }
085
086  /**
087   * Creates a new {@link Assignability}.
088   *
089   * @param tes a {@link TypeAndElementSource}; may be {@code null} in which case the return value of an invocation of
090   * {@link Lang#typeAndElementSource()} will be used instead
091   *
092   * @see TypeAndElementSource
093   *
094   * @see Lang#typeAndElementSource()
095   */
096  public Assignability(final TypeAndElementSource tes) {
097    super();
098    this.tes = tes == null ? Lang.typeAndElementSource() : tes;
099  }
100
101
102  /*
103   * Instance methods.
104   */
105
106
107  @Override // Constable
108  public final Optional<? extends ConstantDesc> describeConstable() {
109    if (this.tes instanceof Constable c) {
110      return c.describeConstable()
111        .map(tesDesc -> DynamicConstantDesc.of(BSM_INVOKE,
112                                               MethodHandleDesc.ofConstructor(CD_Assignability,
113                                                                              CD_TypeAndElementSource),
114                                               tesDesc));
115    }
116    return Optional.empty();
117  }
118
119  /**
120   * Returns {@code true} if and only if at least one {@link TypeMirror} present in the supplied {@code payloads}
121   * argument {@linkplain #matches(TypeMirror, TypeMirror) matches} the supplied {@code receiver} argument.
122   *
123   * @param receiver the left hand side of a type assignment; must not be {@code null}
124   *
125   * @param payloads an {@link Iterable} of {@link TypeMirror}s each representing a potential right hand side of a type
126   * assignment; must not be {@code null}
127   *
128   * @return {@code true} if and only if at least one {@link TypeMirror} present in the supplied {@code payloads}
129   * argument {@linkplain #matches(TypeMirror, TypeMirror) matches} the supplied {@code receiver} argument; {@code
130   * false} otherwise
131   *
132   * @exception NullPointerException if either argument is {@code null}
133   *
134   * @see #matches(TypeMirror, TypeMirror)
135   */
136  // Is at least one payload assignable to the receiver? That is, does at least one payload "match the receiver" in CDI
137  // parlance?
138  public final boolean oneMatches(final TypeMirror receiver, final Iterable<? extends TypeMirror> payloads) {
139    for (final TypeMirror payload : payloads) {
140      if (matches(receiver, payload)) {
141        return true;
142      }
143    }
144    return false;
145  }
146
147  /**
148   * Returns {@code true} if and only if the supplied {@code payload} argument <a
149   * href="https://jakarta.ee/specifications/cdi/4.0/jakarta-cdi-spec-4.0#performing_typesafe_resolution"><em>matches</em></a>
150   * the supplied {@code receiver} argument, according to the rules defined by <a
151   * href="https://jakarta.ee/specifications/cdi/4.0/jakarta-cdi-spec-4.0#performing_typesafe_resolution">section
152   * 2.4.2.1 of the CDI specification</a>.
153   *
154   * @param receiver the left hand side of a type assignment; must not be {@code null}
155   *
156   * @param payload the right hand side of a type assignment; must not be {@code null}
157   *
158   * @return {@code true} if and only if the supplied {@code payload} argument <a
159   * href="https://jakarta.ee/specifications/cdi/4.0/jakarta-cdi-spec-4.0#performing_typesafe_resolution">matches</a>
160   * the supplied {@code receiver} argument, according to the rules defined by <a
161   * href="https://jakarta.ee/specifications/cdi/4.0/jakarta-cdi-spec-4.0#performing_typesafe_resolution">section
162   * 2.4.2.1 of the CDI specification</a>; {@code false} otherwise
163   *
164   * @exception NullPointerException if either argument is {@code null}
165   */
166  // Is the payload assignable to the receiver? That is, does the payload "match the receiver", in CDI parlance?
167  public final boolean matches(final TypeMirror receiver, final TypeMirror payload) {
168    // "A bean is assignable to a given injection point if:
169    //
170    // "The bean has a bean type [payload] that matches the required type [receiver]. For this purpose..."
171    return receiver == Objects.requireNonNull(payload, "payload") || switch (receiver.getKind()) {
172      // "...primitive types are considered to match their corresponding wrapper types in java.lang..."
173      case BOOLEAN -> payload.getKind() == TypeKind.BOOLEAN || declaredTypeNamed(payload, "java.lang.Boolean");
174      case BYTE    -> payload.getKind() == TypeKind.BYTE    || declaredTypeNamed(payload, "java.lang.Byte");
175      case CHAR    -> payload.getKind() == TypeKind.CHAR    || declaredTypeNamed(payload, "java.lang.Character");
176      case DOUBLE  -> payload.getKind() == TypeKind.DOUBLE  || declaredTypeNamed(payload, "java.lang.Double");
177      case FLOAT   -> payload.getKind() == TypeKind.FLOAT   || declaredTypeNamed(payload, "java.lang.Float");
178      case INT     -> payload.getKind() == TypeKind.INT     || declaredTypeNamed(payload, "java.lang.Integer");
179      case LONG    -> payload.getKind() == TypeKind.LONG    || declaredTypeNamed(payload, "java.lang.Long");
180      case SHORT   -> payload.getKind() == TypeKind.SHORT   || declaredTypeNamed(payload, "java.lang.Short");
181      // "...and array types are considered to match only if their element types [note: not component types] are
182      // identical [undefined]..."
183      case ARRAY -> payload.getKind() == TypeKind.ARRAY && identical(elementType(receiver), elementType(payload));
184      case DECLARED -> switch (payload.getKind()) {
185        // "...primitive types are considered to match their corresponding wrapper types in java.lang..."
186        case BOOLEAN -> named((DeclaredType)receiver, "java.lang.Boolean");
187        case BYTE    -> named((DeclaredType)receiver, "java.lang.Byte");
188        case CHAR    -> named((DeclaredType)receiver, "java.lang.Character");
189        case DOUBLE  -> named((DeclaredType)receiver, "java.lang.Double");
190        case FLOAT   -> named((DeclaredType)receiver, "java.lang.Float");
191        case INT     -> named((DeclaredType)receiver, "java.lang.Integer");
192        case LONG    -> named((DeclaredType)receiver, "java.lang.Long");
193        case SHORT   -> named((DeclaredType)receiver, "java.lang.Short");
194        // "Parameterized and raw types [and non-generic classes, and non-array types]..."
195        case DECLARED ->
196          // "...are considered to match if they are identical [undefined]..."
197          identical(receiver, payload) ||
198          // "...or if the bean type [payload] is assignable [see #assignable(TypeMirror, TypeMirror)] to the required
199          // type [receiver]...."
200          assignable((DeclaredType)receiver, (DeclaredType)payload);
201        default -> throw new IllegalArgumentException("Illegal payload kind: " + payload.getKind() + "; payload: " + payload);
202      };
203      default -> throw new IllegalArgumentException("Illegal receiver kind: " + receiver.getKind() + "; receiver: " + receiver);
204    };
205  }
206
207  /**
208   * Returns the {@link TypeAndElementSource} used by this {@link Assignability}.
209   *
210   * @return the {@link TypeAndElementSource} used by this {@link Assignability}; never {@code null}
211   *
212   * @see #Assignability(TypeAndElementSource)
213   *
214   * @see TypeAndElementSource
215   */
216  public final TypeAndElementSource typeAndElementSource() {
217    return this.tes;
218  }
219
220  /*
221   * Private methods.
222   */
223
224  private final boolean assignable(final TypeMirror receiver, final TypeMirror payload) {
225    return switch (payload) {
226      // "A parameterized bean type [payload] is considered assignable..."
227      case DeclaredType parameterizedPayload when parameterized(payload) -> switch (receiver) {
228        // "...to a [non-generic class or] raw required type [receiver]..."
229        case TypeMirror rawReceiver when !generic(receiver) || raw(receiver) -> {
230          // "...if the [non-generic class or] raw types are identical [undefined] and all type parameters [arguments]
231          // of the bean type [payload] are either unbounded type variables [undefined] or java.lang.Object."
232          yield
233            identical(nonGenericClassOrRawType(rawReceiver), nonGenericClassOrRawType(parameterizedPayload)) &&
234            allTypeArgumentsAre(parameterizedPayload.getTypeArguments(),
235                                ((Predicate<TypeMirror>)Assignability::unboundedTypeVariable).or(Assignability::isJavaLangObject));
236        }
237        // "...to a parameterized required type [receiver]..."
238        case DeclaredType parameterizedReceiver when parameterized(receiver) -> {
239          // "...if they have identical raw type [really if their declarations/elements are identical]..."
240          if (identical(rawType(receiver), rawType(parameterizedPayload))) {
241            // "...and for each parameter [type argument] [pair]..."
242            final List<? extends TypeMirror> rtas = parameterizedReceiver.getTypeArguments();
243            final List<? extends TypeMirror> ptas = parameterizedPayload.getTypeArguments();
244            assert rtas.size() == ptas.size();
245            for (int i = 0; i < rtas.size(); i++) {
246              final TypeMirror rta = rtas.get(i);
247              final TypeMirror pta = ptas.get(i);
248              // "...the required [receiver] type parameter [argument] and the bean [payload] type parameter [argument]
249              // are actual [non-type variable, non-wildcard reference] types..."
250              if (actual(rta)) {
251                if (actual(pta)) {
252                  // "...with identical [non-generic classes or] raw type[s]..."
253                  if (identical(nonGenericClassOrRawType(rta), nonGenericClassOrRawType(pta))) {
254                    // "...and, if the type [?] is parameterized [?]..."
255                    //
256                    // Let rta and pta be array types with parameterized element types, such as List<Number>[] and
257                    // List<String>[]. Then their raw types are List[] and List[]. Their parameterized element types are
258                    // List<Number> and List<String>. According to the JLS, neither List<Number>[] nor List<String>[] is
259                    // parameterized.
260                    //
261                    // In this example, if we get here, we have only proven that List[] is "identical" to List[].
262                    //
263                    // The "if the type is parameterized" clause is tough. Which type is under discussion? "the type"
264                    // seems to refer to the "identical raw type". But a raw type by definition is not parameterized, so
265                    // this clause would seem to be superfluous and thus never apply, and so List<Number>[] :=
266                    // List<String>[] is OK. Oops.
267                    //
268                    // Or what if the "if the type is parameterized" clause means the receiver type itself and somehow
269                    // loosely the payload type as well? Well, clearly it cannot correctly do this, since an array type
270                    // is never a parameterized type. Same bad result. Oops.
271                    //
272                    // Or what if "identical raw type" really means "identical raw type (or identical component type if
273                    // they are array types)"? That would be most efficient, since it would rule out List<Number>[] :=
274                    // List<String>[] right off the bat: we wouldn't even get here. But that really doesn't seem to be
275                    // what is meant.
276                    //
277                    // What if the "if the type is parameterized" clause really means "if the type declaration used by
278                    // both the receiver and payload types is generic"? That would work. That's also equivalent to
279                    // something like: "...if at least one of the two arguments is a parameterized type [e.g. List<Number>,
280                    // not List<Number>[], not String, not List], or at least one of the two types is an array type with
281                    // a parameterized element type [e.g. List<Number>[], not List[], not String[]]..."
282                    //
283                    // That is the interpretation we apply here. So:
284                    //
285                    //   "...and, if the type [?] is parameterized..."
286                    //
287                    // becomes:
288                    //
289                    //   "...and, if at least one of the two type arguments is a parameterized type, or if at least one
290                    //   of the two types is an array type with a parameterized element type..."
291                    //
292                    // That, in turn, designates any type capable of properly yielding a raw type, while ruling out
293                    // those that can't! That means it is exactly equal to our yieldsRawType(TypeMirror) method, and so
294                    // that's what cdiParameterized(TypeMirror) returns.
295                    if (cdiParameterized(rta)) {
296                      assert cdiParameterized(pta); // ...because otherwise their raw types would not have been "identical"
297                      // "...the bean type parameter [argument] is assignable to the required type parameter [argument]
298                      // according to [all of] these rules [including 'matching']..."
299                      if (matches(rta, pta)) {
300                        continue;
301                      }
302                      yield false;
303                    } else {
304                      assert !cdiParameterized(pta);
305                      continue;
306                    }
307                  }
308                  yield false;
309                } else if (pta.getKind() == TypeKind.TYPEVAR) {
310                  // "...the required [receiver] type parameter [argument] is an actual [non-type variable, non-wildcard
311                  // reference] type, the bean [payload] type parameter [argument] is a type variable and the actual
312                  // [non-type variable, non-wildcard reference] type [required type argument, receiver] is assignable
313                  // to the upper bound, if any, of the type variable [bean type argument, payload] [type variables have
314                  // multiple bounds]..."
315                  if (assignableToCondensedTypeVariableBounds((TypeVariable)pta, (ReferenceType)receiver)) {
316                    continue;
317                  }
318                  yield false;
319                } else {
320                  throw new AssertionError("Unexpected payload type argument kind: " + pta.getKind());
321                }
322              } else if (rta.getKind() == TypeKind.WILDCARD) {
323                // "...the required type parameter [argument] is a wildcard, the bean type parameter [argument] is an
324                // actual [non-type variable, non-wildcard reference] type..."
325                if (actual(pta)) {
326                  // "...and the actual [non-type variable, non-wildcard reference] type is assignable to the upper
327                  // bound, if any, of the wildcard and assignable from the lower bound, if any of the wildcard"
328                  if (assignableToExtendsBound((WildcardType)rta, (ReferenceType)pta) &&
329                      assignableFromSuperBound((ReferenceType)pta, (WildcardType)rta)) {
330                    continue;
331                  }
332                  yield false;
333                } else if (pta.getKind() == TypeKind.TYPEVAR) {
334                  // "...the required [receiver] type parameter [argument] is a wildcard, the bean [payload] type
335                  // parameter [argument] is a type variable and the upper bound of the type variable [a type variable
336                  // has many bounds?] is assignable to or assignable from the upper bound, if any, of the wildcard and
337                  // assignable from the lower bound, if any, of the wildcard"
338                  if ((condensedTypeVariableBoundsAssignableToExtendsBound((WildcardType)rta, (TypeVariable)pta) ||
339                       condensedTypeVariableBoundsAssignableFromExtendsBound((TypeVariable)pta, (WildcardType)rta)) &&
340                      condensedTypeVariableBoundsAssignableFromSuperBound((TypeVariable)pta, (WildcardType)rta)) {
341                    continue;
342                  }
343                  yield false;
344                } else {
345                  throw new AssertionError("Unexpected payload type argument kind: " + pta.getKind());
346                }
347              } else if (rta.getKind() == TypeKind.TYPEVAR) {
348                if (pta.getKind() == TypeKind.TYPEVAR) {
349                  // "...the required type parameter [argument] and the bean type parameter [argument] are both type
350                  // variables and the upper bound of the required type parameter [argument] [a type variable has many
351                  // bounds?] is assignable to the upper bound [a type variable has many bounds?], if any, of the bean
352                  // type parameter [argument]"
353                  if (condensedTypeVariableBoundsAssignableToCondensedTypeVariableBounds((TypeVariable)pta, (TypeVariable)rta)) {
354                    continue;
355                  }
356                  yield false;
357                } else {
358                  throw new AssertionError("Unexpected payload type argument kind: " + pta.getKind());
359                }
360              } else {
361                throw new AssertionError("Unexpected receiver type argument kind: " + rta.getKind());
362              }
363            }
364            yield true; // we passed all the tests
365          }
366          yield false; // non-generic classes or raw types were not identical
367        }
368        default -> throw new AssertionError("Unexpected receiver kind: " + receiver.getKind());
369      };
370      // "A [non-generic or] raw bean type [payload] is considered assignable..."
371      case TypeMirror nonGenericOrRawPayload -> switch (receiver) {
372        // "...to a parameterized required type [receiver]..."
373        case DeclaredType parameterizedReceiver when parameterized(receiver) -> {
374          // "...if the[ir] [non-generic classes or] raw types are identical and all type parameters [arguments] of the
375          // required type [receiver] are either unbounded type variables or java.lang.Object."
376          yield
377            identical(nonGenericClassOrRawType(parameterizedReceiver), nonGenericOrRawPayload) &&
378            allTypeArgumentsAre(parameterizedReceiver.getTypeArguments(),
379                                ((Predicate<TypeMirror>)Assignability::unboundedTypeVariable).or(Assignability::isJavaLangObject));
380        }
381        // [Otherwise the payload is not assignable to the receiver; identity checking should have already happened in
382        // matches(), not here.]
383        case DeclaredType nonGenericOrRawReceiver when receiver.getKind() == TypeKind.DECLARED -> {
384          yield false; // or yield identical(nonGenericOrRawReceiver, nonGenericOrRawPayload);
385        }
386        default -> throw new AssertionError("Unexpected payload kind: " + payload.getKind() + "; receiver: " + receiver + "; payload: " + payload);
387      };
388    };
389  }
390
391  // Is payload "identical to" receiver, following the intent of CDI?
392  private final boolean identical(final TypeMirror receiver, final TypeMirror payload) {
393    // CDI has an undefined notion of "identical to". This method attempts to divine and implement the intent. Recall
394    // that javax.lang.model.* compares types with "sameType" semantics.
395    return receiver == payload || this.tes.sameType(receiver, payload);
396  }
397
398  // Is the "actual" type argument represented by payload assignable to the receiver's condensed bounds?
399  //
400  // @Inject Foo<String> foo; <-- Bean<T extends CharSequence> // is the "actual" String type (payload) assignable to T's CharSequence bound (receiver)?
401  //
402  // Recall that after condensing "T extends CharSequence" you get CharSequence.
403  //
404  // Recall that if, instead, you had T extends S and S extends CharSequence, condensing T still yields CharSequence.
405  private final boolean assignableToCondensedTypeVariableBounds(final TypeVariable receiver, final ReferenceType payload) {
406    assert receiver.getKind() == TypeKind.TYPEVAR;
407    assert actual(payload);
408    return covariantlyAssignable(List.of(receiver), List.of(payload)); // deliberately List.of(payload) and not condense(payload)
409  }
410
411  private final boolean assignableToExtendsBound(final WildcardType w, final ReferenceType candidate) {
412    assert w.getKind() == TypeKind.WILDCARD;
413    assert actual(candidate);
414    final TypeMirror extendsBound = w.getExtendsBound();
415    return extendsBound == null || covariantlyAssignable((ReferenceType)extendsBound, candidate);
416  }
417
418  // It's not immediately clear what CDI means by a type variable's upper bound. In javax.lang.model.type parlance,
419  // the upper bound of a TypeVariable could be an IntersectionType, which java.lang.reflect.TypeVariable represents
420  // as a collection of bounds. CDI blundered into this earlier: https://issues.redhat.com/browse/CDI-440 and
421  // https://github.com/jakartaee/cdi/issues/682
422  //
423  // "the upper bound of the required type parameter [receiver argument] is assignable to the upper bound, if any, of the bean
424  // type parameter [argument]" (when both arguments are type variables) should read:
425  //
426  // "for each bound, PA, of the bean type parameter [payload argument], there is at least one bound, RA, of the
427  // required type parameter [receiver argument], which is assignable to PA."
428  //
429  // The TCK enforces this, even though it's not in the specification (!).
430  //
431  // Weld's implementation confuses type parameters with arguments, just like the specification. They have a series of
432  // methods implemented as part of PR 614 (https://github.com/weld/core/pull/614) named "parametersMatch" [arguments
433  // match].
434  //
435  // Weld also has methods named things like "getUppermostTypeVariableBounds" and "getUppermostBounds". I think this is
436  // Weld's excruciatingly clumsy way of trying to express the JLS notion of "leftmost bound" (which is also
437  // undefined). See
438  // https://www.oreilly.com/library/view/learning-java-4th/9781449372477/ch08s07.html#learnjava3-CHP-8-SECT-7.1.
439  //
440  // Digging deeper, I think getUppermostTypeVariableBounds(tv) is just erase(tv) applied recursively, maybe? (No, it
441  // turns out; read on.)
442  //
443  // https://github.com/openjdk/jdk/blob/181845ae46157a9bb3bf8e2a328fa59eddc0273a/src/jdk.compiler/share/classes/com/sun/tools/javac/code/Types.java#L2450
444  //
445  // Compare vs.:
446  // https://github.com/weld/core/blob/e894d1699ff1c91332605f5ecae5f53410effb81/impl/src/main/java/org/jboss/weld/resolution/AbstractAssignabilityRules.java#L57-L62
447  //
448  // So maybe not quite. getUppermostTypeVariableBounds() just gets to "actual" types. So given T extends S and S extends
449  // String, T's "uppermost type variable bounds" are String.
450
451  // For every bound in (condensed) receiverBounds, is there a bound in (condensed) payloadBounds that is covariantly
452  // assignable to it?
453  //
454  // (Is there one bound in (condensed) payloadBounds that matches all bounds in (condensed) receiver bounds?
455  //
456  // Throws ClassCastException if, after condensing, any encountered bound is not either an ArrayType or a DeclaredType.
457  private final boolean covariantlyAssignable(List<? extends TypeMirror> receiverBounds, List<? extends TypeMirror> payloadBounds) {
458    payloadBounds = condense(payloadBounds);
459    for (final TypeMirror condensedReceiverBound : condense(receiverBounds)) { // eliminate type variables via condense() call
460      if (!covariantlyAssignable((ReferenceType)condensedReceiverBound, payloadBounds)) {
461        return false;
462      }
463    }
464    return true;
465  }
466
467  // Is there a DeclaredType-or-ArrayType bound in condensedPayloadBounds that is assignable to classOrArrayTypeReceiver
468  // using Java, not CDI, assignability semantics?
469  //
470  // It is assumed condensedPayloadBounds is the result of a condense() call.
471  //
472  // Throws ClassCastException or IllegalArgumentException if any encountered type is not either an ArrayType or a
473  // DeclaredType.
474  private final boolean covariantlyAssignable(final ReferenceType classOrArrayTypeReceiver, final List<? extends TypeMirror> condensedPayloadBounds) {
475    return switch (classOrArrayTypeReceiver.getKind()) {
476    case ARRAY, DECLARED -> {
477      for (final TypeMirror condensedPayloadBound : condensedPayloadBounds) {
478        if (covariantlyAssignable(classOrArrayTypeReceiver, (ReferenceType)condensedPayloadBound)) {
479          yield true;
480        }
481      }
482      yield false;
483    }
484    default -> throw new IllegalArgumentException("classOrArrayTypeReceiver: " + classOrArrayTypeReceiver + "; kind: " + classOrArrayTypeReceiver.getKind());
485    };
486  }
487
488  // Is classOrArrayTypePayload assignable to classOrArrayTypeReceiver following the rules of Java assignability
489  // (i.e. covariance)?
490  //
491  // The types are ReferenceTypes because this is only ever invoked in the context of type arguments.
492  private final boolean covariantlyAssignable(final ReferenceType classOrArrayTypeReceiver, final ReferenceType classOrArrayTypePayload) {
493    assert actual(classOrArrayTypeReceiver);
494    assert actual(classOrArrayTypePayload);
495    return
496      classOrArrayTypeReceiver == classOrArrayTypePayload || // Optimization
497      // Note that TypeAndElementSource#assignable(TypeMirror, TypeMirror) follows the lead of
498      // javax.lang.model.util.Types#isAssignable(TypeMirror, TypeMirror) where the "payload" is the *first* parameter
499      // and the "receiver" is the *second* argument.
500      this.tes.assignable(classOrArrayTypePayload, classOrArrayTypeReceiver); // yes, "backwards"
501  }
502
503  // Are payload's condensed bounds assignable to receiver's condensed extends bound (upper bound)?
504  private final boolean condensedTypeVariableBoundsAssignableToExtendsBound(final WildcardType receiver, final TypeVariable payload) {
505    assert receiver.getKind() == TypeKind.WILDCARD;
506    assert payload.getKind() == TypeKind.TYPEVAR;
507    // "...the upper bound of the type variable [a type variable has many bounds?] is assignable TO [...] the upper
508    // bound, if any, of the wildcard..."
509    final TypeMirror extendsBound = receiver.getExtendsBound();
510    // Condense arguments to eliminate useless type variables and intersection types so that Java covariant semantics
511    // will work properly in this case.
512    return extendsBound == null || covariantlyAssignable(List.of((ReferenceType)extendsBound), List.of(payload)); // No need to condense; #covariantlyAssignable(List, List) does this already
513  }
514
515  // Is payload's condensed extends bound (upper bound) covariantly assignable to receiver's condensed bounds?
516  private final boolean condensedTypeVariableBoundsAssignableFromExtendsBound(final TypeVariable receiver, final WildcardType payload) {
517    assert receiver.getKind() == TypeKind.TYPEVAR;
518    assert payload.getKind() == TypeKind.WILDCARD;
519    // "...the upper bound of the type variable [a type variable has many bounds?] is assignable [...] FROM the upper
520    // bound, if any, of the wildcard..."
521    final TypeMirror extendsBound = payload.getExtendsBound();
522    return extendsBound == null || covariantlyAssignable(List.of(receiver), List.of((ReferenceType)extendsBound));
523  }
524
525  // Is payload's super bound (lower bound) covariantly assignable to receiver's condensed bounds?
526  private final boolean condensedTypeVariableBoundsAssignableFromSuperBound(final TypeVariable receiver, final WildcardType payload) {
527    assert receiver.getKind() == TypeKind.TYPEVAR;
528    assert payload.getKind() == TypeKind.WILDCARD;
529    final TypeMirror superBound = payload.getSuperBound();
530    return superBound == null || covariantlyAssignable(List.of(receiver), List.of(superBound));
531  }
532
533  // Are payload's condensed bounds covariantly assignable to receiver's condensed bounds?
534  private final boolean condensedTypeVariableBoundsAssignableToCondensedTypeVariableBounds(final TypeVariable receiver, final TypeVariable payload) {
535    assert receiver.getKind() == TypeKind.TYPEVAR;
536    assert payload.getKind() == TypeKind.TYPEVAR;
537    return covariantlyAssignable(List.of(receiver), List.of(payload));
538  }
539
540  // Is payload's super bound (lower bound) covariantly assignable to receiver?
541  private final boolean assignableFromSuperBound(final ReferenceType receiver, final WildcardType payload) {
542    assert payload.getKind() == TypeKind.WILDCARD;
543    assert actual(receiver);
544    final ReferenceType superBound = (ReferenceType)payload.getSuperBound();
545    return superBound == null || covariantlyAssignable(receiver, superBound);
546  }
547
548  // Get the raw type yielded by t, assuming t is the sort of type that can yield a raw type.
549  //
550  // An array type with a parameterized element type can yield a raw type.
551  //
552  // A declared type that is parameterized can yield a raw type.
553  //
554  // No other type yields a raw type.
555  private final TypeMirror rawType(final TypeMirror t) {
556    return switch (t.getKind()) {
557    case ARRAY -> {
558      final TypeMirror et = elementType(t);
559      if (!parameterized(et)) {
560        throw new IllegalArgumentException("t is an array type whose element type is not parameterized so cannot yield a raw type");
561      }
562      yield arrayType(erasure(et));
563    }
564    case DECLARED -> {
565      if (!parameterized(t)) {
566        throw new IllegalArgumentException("t is a declared type that is not parameterized so cannot yield a raw type");
567      }
568      yield erasure(t);
569    }
570    default -> throw new IllegalArgumentException("t is a " + t.getKind() + " type and so cannot yield a raw type");
571    };
572  }
573
574  // Return t if its element declares a non-generic class, or if it is the raw type usage of a generic class.
575  private final TypeMirror nonGenericClassOrRawType(final TypeMirror t) {
576    return yieldsRawType(t) ? rawType(t) : t;
577  }
578
579  // Erase t and return its erasure. Erasing is a complex business that can involve the creation of new types.
580  private final TypeMirror erasure(final TypeMirror t) {
581    return this.tes.erasure(t);
582  }
583
584  // Return a possibly new ArrayType whose component type is the supplied componentType.
585  private final ArrayType arrayType(final TypeMirror componentType) {
586    return this.tes.arrayTypeOf(componentType);
587  }
588
589
590  /*
591   * Static methods.
592   */
593
594
595  // If t is null, returns an empty List.
596  //
597  // If t is a type variable, returns the result of condensing its upper bound.
598  //
599  // If t is an intersection type, returns the result of condensing its bounds.
600  //
601  // In all other cases returns List.of(t).
602  //
603  // See #condense(List) below.
604  private static final List<? extends TypeMirror> condense(final TypeMirror t) {
605    return t == null ? List.of() : switch (t.getKind()) {
606    case INTERSECTION -> condense(((IntersectionType)t).getBounds());
607    case TYPEVAR -> condense(((TypeVariable)t).getUpperBound());
608    default -> List.of(t); // t's bounds are defined solely by itself, or it's a wildcard and we didn't say which bounds
609    };
610  }
611
612  // If ts is null or empty, returns an empty List.
613  //
614  // If ts consists of a single element, returns the result of condensing t (see #condense(TypeMirror) above).
615  //
616  // If ts's first element (of several) is an intersection type i, returns the result of condensing the list formed by
617  // effectively replacing ts's first element with i's bounds.
618  //
619  // If ts's first element (of several) is a type variable tv, returns the result of condensing the list formed by
620  // effectively replacing ts's first element with tv's upper bound.
621  //
622  // In all other cases, returns ts.
623  private static final List<? extends TypeMirror> condense(final List<? extends TypeMirror> ts) {
624    final int size = ts == null ? 0 : ts.size();
625    if (size <= 0) {
626      return List.of();
627    }
628    final TypeMirror ts0 = ts.get(0);
629    if (size == 1) {
630      return condense(ts0);
631    }
632    return switch (ts0.getKind()) {
633    case INTERSECTION -> {
634      final ArrayList<TypeMirror> newBounds = new ArrayList<>();
635      newBounds.addAll(((IntersectionType)ts0).getBounds()); // first elements are now ts0's bounds, not ts0
636      newBounds.addAll(ts.subList(1, size)); // drop ts0; add whatever was left
637      newBounds.trimToSize();
638      yield condense(newBounds);
639    }
640    case TYPEVAR -> {
641      final ArrayList<TypeMirror> newBounds = new ArrayList<>();
642      newBounds.add(((TypeVariable)ts0).getUpperBound()); // first element is now ts0's upper bound, not ts0
643      newBounds.addAll(ts.subList(1, size)); // drop ts0; add whatever was left
644      newBounds.trimToSize();
645      yield condense(newBounds);
646    }
647    default -> ts;
648    };
649  }
650
651  // Does e represent a generic declaration?
652  //
653  // A declaration is generic if it declares one or more type parameters.
654  //
655  // Since an annotation interface cannot declare type parameters, it follows that TypeElements representing annotation
656  // instances are never generic.
657  private static final boolean generic(final Element e) {
658    return switch (e.getKind()) {
659    case CLASS, CONSTRUCTOR, ENUM, INTERFACE, METHOD, RECORD -> !((Parameterizable)e).getTypeParameters().isEmpty();
660    default -> false;
661    };
662  }
663
664  // Is t the usage of a generic class, i.e. a usage (whether raw or parameterized) of a generic class declaration?
665  //
666  // t is deemed to be generic if it is a declared type whose defining element (its type declaration) is generic.
667  //
668  // Array types are never generic.
669  private static final boolean generic(final TypeMirror t) {
670    return t.getKind() == TypeKind.DECLARED && generic(((DeclaredType)t).asElement());
671  }
672
673  // Is t a parameterized type (and not a raw type) according to the rules of the Java Language Specification?
674  //
675  // A type is parameterized if it is a declared type with a non-empty list of type arguments. No other type is
676  // parameterized.
677  //
678  // "parameterized" means "supplies arguments for type parameters"
679  private static final boolean parameterized(final TypeMirror t) {
680    return t.getKind() == TypeKind.DECLARED && !((DeclaredType)t).getTypeArguments().isEmpty();
681  }
682
683  // Is t a type that CDI considers to be "parameterized"?
684  //
685  // There are some cases, but not all, where CDI (incorrectly) considers an array type to be something that can be
686  // parameterized, or else "bean type parameter" resolution would never work. See
687  // https://stackoverflow.com/questions/76493672/when-cdi-speaks-of-a-parameterized-type-does-it-also-incorrectly-mean-array-typ.
688  //
689  // The semantics CDI wants to express are really: can t yield a raw type? See #yieldsRawType(TypeMirror) below.
690  private static final boolean cdiParameterized(final TypeMirror t) {
691    return yieldsRawType(t);
692  }
693
694  // Can t yield a raw type?
695  //
696  // To yield a raw type, t must be either:
697  //
698  // * an array type with a parameterized element type
699  // * a declared type with at least one type argument
700  private static final boolean yieldsRawType(final TypeMirror t) {
701    return parameterized(t) || t.getKind() == TypeKind.ARRAY && parameterized(elementType(t));
702  }
703
704  // Is t a raw type, following the rules of the Java Language Specification, not CDI?
705  //
706  // A raw type is either "the erasure of a parameterized type" (so List<String>'s raw type is List, clearly not
707  // List<?>, and not List<E>) or "an array type whose element type is a raw type" (so List<String>[]'s raw type is
708  // List[]). (String is not a raw type; its element defines no type parameters.)
709  //
710  // No other type is a raw type.
711  //
712  // CDI gets confused and uses "raw" in different senses. The sense used here is that of the Java Language
713  // Specification.
714  private static final boolean raw(final TypeMirror t) {
715    return switch (t.getKind()) {
716    case ARRAY -> raw(elementType((ArrayType)t));
717    case DECLARED -> generic(t) && ((DeclaredType)t).getTypeArguments().isEmpty();
718    case TYPEVAR -> false; // called out explicitly just so you realize it
719    default -> false;
720    };
721  }
722
723  // Is t a declared type that bears the supplied fully qualified name?
724  private static final boolean declaredTypeNamed(final TypeMirror t, final CharSequence n) {
725    return t.getKind() == TypeKind.DECLARED && named(((DeclaredType)t), n);
726  }
727
728  // Regardless of its reported TypeKind, does t's declaring TypeElement bear the supplied fully qualified name?
729  //
730  // Throws ClassCastException if the return value of t.asElement() is not a TypeElement.
731  private static final boolean named(final DeclaredType t, final CharSequence n) {
732    // (No getKind() check on purpose.)
733    return ((TypeElement)t.asElement()).getQualifiedName().contentEquals(n);
734  }
735
736  // Do all supplied TypeMirrors pass the test represented by the supplied Predicate?
737  private static final boolean allTypeArgumentsAre(final Iterable<? extends TypeMirror> typeArguments, final Predicate<? super TypeMirror> p) {
738    for (final TypeMirror t : typeArguments) {
739      if (!p.test(t)) {
740        return false;
741      }
742    }
743    return true;
744  }
745
746  // Is e a TypeElement representing java.lang.Object?
747  private static final boolean isJavaLangObject(final Element e) {
748    return
749      e.getKind() == ElementKind.CLASS &&
750      ((QualifiedNameable)e).getQualifiedName().contentEquals("java.lang.Object");
751  }
752
753  // Is t a DeclaredType whose asElement() method returns an Element representing java.lang.Object?
754  private static final boolean isJavaLangObject(final TypeMirror t) {
755    return
756      t.getKind() == TypeKind.DECLARED &&
757      isJavaLangObject(((DeclaredType)t).asElement());
758  }
759
760  // Is t an "actual type"?
761  //
762  // CDI mentions actual types but does not define what they are. This method attempts to divine and implement the
763  // intent.
764  //
765  // A comment in a closed bug report (CDI-502)
766  // (https://issues.redhat.com/browse/CDI-502?focusedId=13036118&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels%3Acomment-tabpanel#comment-13036118)
767  // by one of the reference implementation's authors (Jozef Hartinger) provides the only definition:
768  //
769  // "An actual type is a type that is not a wildcard nor [sic] an unresolved [sic] type variable."
770  //
771  // The Java Language Specification does not mention anything about "actual types" or type variable resolution. CDI
772  // does not mention anything about type variable resolution.
773  //
774  // More strictly, therefore, the intent seems to be that an actual type is an array, declared or primitive type, and
775  // none other.
776  private static final boolean actual(final TypeMirror t) {
777    return switch (t.getKind()) {
778    case ARRAY, BOOLEAN, BYTE, CHAR, DECLARED, DOUBLE, FLOAT, INT, LONG, SHORT -> true;
779    default -> false;
780    };
781  }
782
783  // Is t an unbounded type variable?
784  //
785  // CDI does not define what an "unbounded type variable" is. This method attempts to divine and implement the intent.
786  //
787  // TODO: do we need to condense? Given T extends S and S extends Object, is T an unbounded TypeVariable or not?
788  private static final boolean unboundedTypeVariable(final TypeMirror t) {
789    return
790      t.getKind() == TypeKind.TYPEVAR &&
791      isJavaLangObject(((TypeVariable)t).getUpperBound());
792  }
793
794  // Returns the element type of t.
795  //
796  // The element type of an array type is the element type of its component type.
797  //
798  // The element type of every other kind of type is the type itself.
799  private static final TypeMirror elementType(final TypeMirror t) {
800    return t.getKind() == TypeKind.ARRAY ? elementType(((ArrayType)t).getComponentType()) : t;
801  }
802
803}
